summary: John Willard is identified as an alias of Eric Starvo Galt and Harvey Lowmyer, who is suspected of assassinating Martin Luther King, Jr. The documents consist of cables disseminating information about Galt/Lowmyer/Willard to various locations worldwide, seeking assistance in locating him. The cables provide physical descriptions and aliases to aid in the search. The documents all originate on the same date, April 18, 1968, shortly after the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr.
significance: John Willard is an alias of a suspect in the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., making him a person of interest in the investigation following the assassination.
